data.title: A Trio of Tennessee Williams
data.meta_description: Fox and Hound Theatre presents a rare opportunity to see three of Williams' lesser known short plays.
data.text:
“…an opportunity to be awakened from passivity and indifference”

Fox and Hound Theatre presents a rare opportunity to see three of Williams’ lesser known short plays:

Play 1: Ivan’s Widow

Attempting to cope with her husband’s death, a widow seeks answers from her psychiatrist- a cold, predatory and promiscuous man with a seemingly genuine concern for his patient. The widow struggles to differentiate between fantasy and reality but who’s truth is real?

Play 2: Talk to Me Like the Rain and Let Me Listen

A couple find themselves in a cycle of deprivation. The scene between them is one of eternal repetition, where emotions are worn out and the hopelessly unalterable is accepted.

Play 3: 27 Wagons Full of Cotton

In desperate times, the rules are different. Do two wrongs make a right? A dysfunctional relationship is at the centre of this disturbing look at abuse and how one woman may find her silver lining.

CREATIVE TEAM

Producer: Helen Fox

Director: Ellie Jay Stevens

Designer: Fiona McKeon

Cast: Codge Crawford, Helen Fox & Massimiliano Acerbi
